column5: ....Great looking dog Chris. Hope you're bringing him up to Lakair.

WTG Chris! He is adorable! I have an older, larger version of him at home. Looks like Lab / Border Collie cross? They are very intelligent dogs and make the best of pets. You have done a good thing by bringing him home.  Ours loves the snow. As soon as he gets out there in the yard, he immediately buries his head under the snow and tosses his head in the air!  Enjoy your new bud!
Good for you bud.. hes pretty cute!
Awesome Pup, congrats!! So jealous.   Cheers, 1leg

He is one happy little hoolagin !!!! He does the head under the snow thing as well....crazy lil fella. Unfortunately he' s not going to be up at Lakair in June cause it would be to much for me having to babysit him and fish'party   . Aug 9 I will be returning to Lakair with Carol and my folks and...........Arnie and Sam,the dynamic dual !!!! Arnie will have to teach Sam proper boat edicate...Wait till dad catches fish and sets it on the bottom of the boat and then lick the fish and bark like hell!!!!  Chris

About three weeks ago Carol and I adopted a puppy from a good friend of mine. He was one out of ten pups in the litter. The rest of the pups were adopted first but he was left behind,unwanted by all who came and you will never guess why.....He's blind in one eye.He was born with a condition that occured in mothers womb that stops the retina development in the prestages. Carol and I couldn't help ourselves... We took him home and named him Samson because of his strength and courage.......Here are a couple before and after shots so far.      Here's mom   Now he's about 25 pounds and still growing !!!! Pics to come.....  Cheers !!!
ohh man hes a cutie congrats
Disability=strength  Now you're in trouble!
Great looking puppy congrats I'm sure he will be lots of fun  rob
Nice Pup ya got there! May your family and the pup have many enjoyable years
Well, he might have been the last one picked but he got the best home of the litter!
Nice Pup... have fun...  Ken
Nice pooch Chris
Awwww. he so cute, i love puppies  oopsdang back button....  Maureen
Awwww. he so cute, i love puppies   Have fun with him Chris, I bet he doesn't like to sleep in like your other fella Arnie  Maureen

Thank god for that Mo. Theres no more room under the covers for another pooch even in our king size...He sleeps on top of the covers at the end of the bed with the two cats. Thats how Carol and I know we have enough pets...Two dogs two cats is maxed out !!!!
Hey Chris, way to step up, thats a beatiful pup. Congrats.
Great stuff, some things are meant to be.
Adorable!   Hard to resist a puppy, especially one that cute!!  Enjoy
Great looking pup Chris, he's a lucky boy!  J...
Awww, what a sweetie, just like his new owner  I know he's got a good home, lucky dog.  Joey
Good on you Chris for giving that puppy a home and a wonderful life.
Yer heart is in the right place. Hope the lil cuss is fine otherwise. Old Duke says hi!
Congrats on you new family member!  And he won't even know that he's blind in one eye.  It's just normal to him.
Good to hear the little guy has a new home and lots of love.
Great stuff Bud!!!  Love to hear stories like this
great looking Pooch Chris!

Thanx for all the kind words folks. Sams a very lucky pup and Carol and I feel very priveledged to  to have him. He seems to like snow> I think he's got more of his toys outside in the yard than he does in the house. Only problem now is all his outdoor toys are under about a foot of snow   Cheers!!
Nice lookin dog he will keep ya happy for years to come
aww! soo cute. i'm so glad you guys adopted him. does the blindness affect his life much? he sure seems like a happy pup
